senses.de: More luxurious or costly than usual.
senses.ex: He booked a deluxe room with a balcony in the hotel.

Tips.title: Pricing Indicator
Tips.description: Indicates an item is more expensive and opulent than common versions.
Tips.example: She chose the deluxe model of the car for its premium features.

Tips.title: Extra Features
Tips.description: Suggests additional amenities that standard options don't include.
Tips.example: The deluxe tour package offers private guided excursions.

Tips.title: Marketing Appeal
Tips.description: Often used in advertising to attract customers seeking quality and comfort.
Tips.example: The hotel's deluxe experience promises unparalleled service.

Exclusive.wordDefinition:
Exclusive means something that is limited or restricted to a particular group or person.

It is often used to describe a product or service that is not available to everyone, but only to a select few. For example, an exclusive club membership would only be available to those who meet certain criteria, such as having a high net worth or a specific profession.

So, while deluxe refers to quality, exclusive refers to accessibility.

Deluxe can apply to a wide range of products and services, while exclusive typically applies to high-end or specialty offerings.

Extravagant.wordDefinition:
For example, a deluxe hotel room might have nicer amenities or a larger size than a standard room, but it would not be wildly extravagant.

Extravagant refers to something that goes beyond what is necessary, reasonable, or expected. It implies excessive luxury or indulgence.

For example, an extravagant hotel room might have a private butler or a gold-plated bathtub.

Deluxe means high quality but reasonable, while extravagant means excessive and lavish. Each word can be applicable in different contexts depending on the level of luxury or indulgence being described.

Lavish.wordDefinition:
Lavish, on the other hand, describes something that is extravagant, luxuriant or opulent.

It describes something that is excessive or overly elaborate. For example, a lavish party may have a lot of decorations, expensive food, and entertainment.

So essentially, deluxe refers to something that's considered "better" than the standard or basic version, while lavish refers to something that's considered "more" than what's necessary or expected.

Luxurious.wordDefinition:
Luxurious usually means something that is very rich, elegant, or comfortable. It suggests a sense of indulgence, extravagance, or superior quality.

For example, a luxurious car might have leather seats, advanced technology, and a high-end sound system.

Deluxe implies an upgraded version of something, while luxurious suggests something that is particularly fancy or opulent.

Opulent.wordDefinition:
Opulent means richly adorned, excessively lavish, and often implies more than what is necessary or practical.

Deluxe is a step up from standard, while opulent is a step beyond deluxe in terms of luxury and excess.

Posh.wordDefinition:
Posh also means luxurious but usually describes a stylish or fashionable environment, often associated with wealth or exclusivity.

Posh can be applicable to fashion, dining, or living spaces. For example, a posh restaurant would have a trendy or sophisticated atmosphere and be a popular spot for high-end clientele.

The main difference between deluxe and posh is that deluxe refers more to the quality of a product or service, while posh refers to the exclusivity, style, or fashionable aspect of a product, service or environment.

Premium.wordDefinition:
Premium refers to a product or service that is of higher quality and often comes at a higher price.

Premium products usually have superior materials, unique features, or better performance.

Deluxe emphasizes extra or luxurious features, while premium emphasizes higher quality or higher cost. Both terms can be applied to a variety of products and services, but their usage depends on the specific characteristics of the item being described.

Upscale.wordDefinition:
Upscale usually means something that is more expensive and luxurious compared to other options. This higher price is often due to the superior quality and exclusivity of the product or service.

Deluxe is used when referring to an upgraded version with more features or luxury, while upscale is used when referring to an exclusive and expensive product or service.

videos.Text: special interested in the predatory spirit and fearless can I come and interview you about your special brain anomaly and he said come on over so I went to our deluxe Grand Florida mansion
videos.Title: Strange answers to the...

videos.Text: and that's why I've always said in my life every day in the bush is a different day every day is like reading a new page on a book and look at that see how deluxe they are

quotes.Text: I published, privately, a collection of my serious poetry I had written over the years. I only published 50 copies, which I gave to friends, in a special deluxe edition. It was ridiculously expensive but I'm glad that I did it.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Tom Glazer

quotes.Text: Creating deluxe cuisine is like playing a sport. Always competitive. Always challenging. And if you slow down a bit, you can no longer return to the top level.
quotes.Title: French Chef
quotes.Name: Joel Robuchon

quotes.Text: My season 2 'Good Wife' wrap gift was this deluxe package of Mortal Kombat. I played it for, like, two weeks straight.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Matt Czuchry

quotes.Text: Color has always been important to me, ever since my first deluxe box of Crayolas.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Susan Vreeland
